Articles.Content:
Sorry if this has been suggested before, but I've looked around and haven't found anything. 

I don't know whether this is a problem for most people, but I find that usually by a couple weeks to a month into a save, I have enough crafts that only a couple pixels of scroll are enough to move crafts from the bottom of the menu to off the top. This of course makes it hard to find the craft I want to work on. It occurs to me that this is probably a common problem.

A craft search by name seems like it wouln't be too hard to add.

Now that it's been brought up, a folder system would be awesome too!

What do you all think? Would you want these added?

Edited June 12, 2016 by EpicSpaceTroll139
Folder system

Yeah, I've wanted this many times. Same thing for searching for a particular save. I think it should also work that when you press a letter on the keyboard, it skips straight to the craft and saves beginning with that letter.
I fully support this suggestion. It would also help a lot if the craft selection window could be made taller somehow, but a search bar would be the more flexible aid.

This would be very useful. I had to store some of my Sandbox crafts in a backup folder because it was too hard to navigate. There is already a search bar for parts, so the technology is there. The 'first letter only' search would cut down scrolling time for sure. However, players who use naming conventions might have disproportionate craft under certain letters which would reduce the effectiveness of single letter jumps. Other organizational tools like folders could also help solve this problem.
Yes. I've said this before, but a 'folder' system would be my preferred option.  Both for vessels in the editors and flights in the tracking station.
